column4: President Trump ceased the incoming flights from China when the COVID-19 pandemic began. Without a doubt @realDonaldTrump saved many American lives and is willing to stand up to China. Now it is time to get answers. https://t.co/YKTrxIfmPI

Idaho is home to more than 120,000 veterans that deserve physical and mental care from qualified health care professionals. I am proud to vote YES on H.R. 3228, a bill that would expand the amount of employees available @DeptVetAffairs for TeleHealth care. https://t.co/vIzJPX461V

COVID-19 has placed a great strain on our federal budget. As we continue to battle the virus and begin our economic recovery, we must be mindful that exploding budgets have dangerous consequences of their own. https://t.co/hL6uJYxSNX

Veterans suicide rate is more than twice the general population. I voted YES on S. 785 to make education & grants a priority for suicide-prevention services at @DeptVetAffairs, & to improve mental healthcare. The VA will now provide hearing aid services at every medical center.

Medical decisions should be in the hands of patients & families-- not Washington bureaucrats. 
Initiatives I support: 
✔️American Healthshare Plans of 2020 
✔️HSA's for All Act to increase options for health expenses
✔️ESTP plans to protect those with pre-existing conditions https://t.co/9IokXRBUNY

Lilian also gave me first-hand insight into students returning to school and changes in education during the pandemic. https://t.co/bG31Qpkrpo

I met with the Idaho Technical Career Academy to discuss virtual education and how the academy has been impacted by COVID-19.  These technical career opportunities are so important for our communities, and ITCA is working hard to make sure these programs stay available. https://t.co/NLKu2rITbS

Great to see @realDonaldTrump prioritizing our American values of discovery and innovation. R&D is important to solving current and future problems, particularly in the fields of health treatments, industries of the future, security, and the workforce. 

https://t.co/ItSVTfQEhj

Because of COVID precautions, public fundraising events or visits have not been an option for the Boise Veterans Center. In leiu, they created the Resident Wish List to fulfill the needs of the home.  Learn more here: https://t.co/DOQupjRFju

We sent a letter to @stevenmnuchin1 asking the IRS not to treat abortion as regular health care, unless mother’s life is in danger. It ensures all necessary medical care for the mother.
Read the full letter here: https://t.co/crJbtnLBO9 https://t.co/Grs7H3dfhw

During @realDonaldTrump recent press conference he shared the below document highlighting the steps his Administration has taken in response to COVID-19. Great work in this unprecedented time. https://t.co/Q6Tppw2Hwa

I applaud @realDonaldTrump for making veterans a priority in his administration. 
https://t.co/EzwBQ499Up

https://t.co/tnYR9sTyLT

U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Secretary Robert L. Wilkie announced the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs began reintroducing health care services in 23 select VA facilities May 18, including the Boise VA Medical Center. https://t.co/reTnVzJa37

Teachers are rising to meet unprecedented challenges during this pandemic. Now more than ever, we need to show how much they are appreciated! #SendTeachersLove with a message, photo, or video on why they matter to you. https://t.co/ljoQ7O4AVb

A webinar and resources explaining the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program for producers. Growers who have never used Farm Service Agency resources are recommended to view this information and prepare the necessary paperwork ahead of time.
https://t.co/fFuG9pMvJn
The bill contains many items that are unrelated to COVID-19 or are progressive policy wishes, rather than solely emergency provisions to support Americans through this period.

Good news from the @US_FDA who has authorized the first antigen test to help in the rapid detection of the COVID-19 virus. 
https://t.co/GNIPQz0pSJ

Great to see companies like Battelle in Idaho Falls decontaminating N95 masks to ensure our state rebounds safely. Around 80,000 respirators can be decontaminated each day allowing them to be reused multiple times. Thank you @Battelle and the @INL site!

This week’s announcement by @SecretarySonny is great news for our farmers and ranchers. The COVID-19 pandemic has caused many of Idaho’s markets to dry up, but our crops continue to grow and our cows continue to produce milk. I look forward to working with the Secretary as we

Nice to see our longtime business partner Taiwan donating 100k masks to Idaho. Taiwan is one of the top 5 export markets for Idaho’s products and this is a great boost to our ongoing and ramped up production in the United States. https://t.co/br4ahvbHb0

To help with the mask shortage, @Battelle is offering mask decontamination services using their Critical Care Decontamination System™. This is being offered at no charge to Idaho hospitals, first responders, & other front-line workers for next 6mos. Info: https://t.co/tnQCwpLBNk

Shoutout to the @CF3DPrinting team, who worked alongside healthcare professionals at @kootenaihealth to design a 3D printed, reusable N95 mask. Learn more about how these First District Idahoans are stepping up: https://t.co/FgIodCMRD5

Idaho Sewing for Sports has stepped up to the plate producing masks and gowns. Thankful for private industries like this company and leaders like CEO Gunther Williams who are committed to helping our communities during this pandemic.

I am supportive of efforts to allow people to either withdraw the 2020 contributions from their FSA accounts to spend on things like health care or childcare, or to rollover any unspent funds from 2020 into 2021. Special shout out to the #CrushTheCurveIdaho project. The mission of this coordinated effort is to procure testing specifically for Idaho essential workers. (health care, grocery, gas station, senior care, airline, food, delivery, etc.) More info:

A Southampton study suggests the # of cases could have been reduced by 95% had China moved to contain the virus 3 weeks sooner. The @USTreasury launched the Employee Retention Credit to encourage businesses to keep employees on their payrolls during the pandemic. The refundable tax credit is 50% of up to $10,000 in wages paid by a financially impacted, eligible employer.
https://t.co/XehhzcPyg4
The @USTreasury has announced delays for tax and reporting due dates for alcohol, tobacco, firearms, and ammunition businesses hit by COVID-19. https://t.co/NItZPKo2kz

Commissioner Andrew Saul @SocialSecurity confirmed that Social Security & SSI benefit payments will be paid on time during this pandemic. 

There are many scammers trying to take advantage of this situation and spreading falsities. Please help us spread the word!
